reloadShaders.desc: Reloads the shaders of the scene and recompiles if possible.

clearColour.desc: The background colour of the scene

toServer.desc: Sends a message to the connected server

bind.desc: binds the provide callback to the eventname. Returns a table with a disconnect method.

toAllClients.desc: Broadcasts a message to all connected clients (server only)

toClient.desc: Broadcasts a message to the connected client (server only)

me.desc: false if not connected, once connected this is set to the current user object

serverId.desc: the id of the connected server

resume.desc: resumes physics and sets running to true

rayTestScreenAllHits.desc: runs a ray test query with our physics engine from the absolute coordinates x,y

rayTestAllHits.desc: runs a ray test query with our physics engine between the start and end points provided

pause.desc: stops the physics engine and sets running to false

rayTestClosest.desc: runs a ray test query with our physics engine between the start and end points provided

rayTestScreen.desc: runs a ray test query with our physics engine from the x,y screen position

running.desc: wherever or not the simulation is running

gravity.desc: the rate of gravity, defaults to 0, -9.8, 0-

post.desc: Is callback is nil, this function yields and returns the httpResult

request.desc: Is callback is nil, this function yields and returns the httpResult.

get.desc: Is callback is nil, this function yields and returns the httpResult

isKeyDown.desc: returns if the key is pressed

isMouseButtonDown.desc: returns if the mouse is down

mouseFocusedGui.desc: The gui element currently capturing the mouse input

disableDefaultLoaders.desc: If true, default scripts are not loaded when the game is in play mode

editExternal.desc: opens the script in the user's default text editor

autoRun.desc: if true, teverse runs this automatically

applyImpulseAtPosition.desc: Applies an impulse force at a relative position to this object

applyImpulse.desc: Applies an impulse force to this object

applyForce.desc: Applies a force to this object

applyTorque.desc: Applies a force to this object

applyForceAtPosition.desc: Applies a force at a relative position to this object

lookAt.desc: Changes the objects rotation so that it is looking towards the provided position.

applyTorqueImpulse.desc: Applies a force to this object

linearFactor.desc: Restricts the linear movement in the physics engine. A value of (1,1,1) allows the object to move in all directions whereas (0,1,0) means the object can only move up and down on the y axis.

doNotSerialise.desc: The built in game serialiser will not serialise objects with this set as true.

meshScale.desc: This is the value Teverse has had to scale the loaded mesh down in order to fit it in a 1x1x1 bounding box

mesh.desc: The file that teverse will use to load a 3d model, using [[resource locators]].

position.desc: Location of the object in 3D space

physics.desc: When true, things like raycasting may not work correctly for this object

static.desc: When true, this object will not move as it will become unaffected by forces including gravity.

opacity.desc: A value of 1 indicates this object is not transparent.

worldToScreen.desc: Converts a 3d cooridinate into screenspace. Returns a bool indicating if the point is infront of the camera, returns a vector2 with the screenspace coordinates,

lookAt.desc: Changes the objects rotation so that it is looking towards the provided position.

position.desc: Location of the sound in 3D space

audioFile.desc: The file that teverse will use to load sound, using [[resource locators]].

getDescendants.desc: Returns a table of all descended objects

isContainer.desc: Returns true if this object can contain other objects.

isA.desc: Returns true if this object is derived from the className given.

destroy.desc: Locks the object before removing it from the hierarchy. Children will also be destroyed.

getFullName.desc: Returns a string including ancestor names

destroyAllChildren.desc: Invokes the destroy method on each child of this instance.

hasChild.desc: Returns true if this object has a child with the name given

isDescendantOf.desc: Returns true if this object is a descendant of the ancestor object given

clone.desc: Creates and returns a copy of this object

childAdded.desc: Fired when a child is added

childRemoved.desc: Fired when a child is removed

destroying.desc: Fired just before an object is destroyed.

className.desc: The name of the object's class
